p: BTB and CNC homology 1 (Bach1) is ubiquitously expressed in mammalian tissues and functions as a transcriptional suppressor of HO-1 by heterodimerizing with small Maf proteins [ 82]. While Nrf2 reportedly activates HO-1, Bach1 binds to the enhancers of the Hmox1 to suppress its expression under normal conditions [ 83]. Knockout of Bach1 affects oxidative stress damage by HO-1 induction [ 84]. Bach1 deficiency reduced the severity of osteoarthritis in mice by inducing HO-1 expression [ 85].
